titlestmt.titleproper: Henry Y. Porter Theater Memorabilia CollectionMS003

publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-10 19:12:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Henry Y. Porter Theater Memorabilia Collection

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into six series: Artists and other celebrities; Olive Fremstad; Scrapbooks, playbills, and programs; Obituary scrapbooks; Phonograph recordings; Political, military, and judicial figures.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Henry Y. Porter (c.1890-c.1950) was employed by Tufts University as an accountant for many years. He was an active collector of theater, opera, and political memorabilia and portraits.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was given to Tufts in 1986 by Porter's estate.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was previously mixed in with other theatre related papers such the Arthur W. Row, Frank E. Fowle and Max Tennis papers, each now a separate collection of their own. Porter was very clear in labeling his collection with a stamp of his name. Every effort has been made to assign materials previously lumped into the Porter Collection to its proper home, either Porter, Row, Fowle, or Tennis' papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is composed of photographs, scrapbooks, cartes de visite, and cabinet card photo album depicting various theater and musical personalities primarily from the 19th and early 20th centuries. Also included are photographs, prints, and clippings of various political, military, and judicial figures, from the 1800s to the 1980s. There are an estimated 10,000 images. The primary focus of the collection is people involved in music, theater, opera, and government.

Porter classified the bulk of the photos by subject and date, and includes handwritten tables of contents for many of the albums. Additionally, there are scrapbooks of obituaries of people represented in the collection.
Porter purchased much of the material from antiques dealers and from auctions.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish.
Any intellectual property rights that the donor possessed have not been transferred to Tufts University.

did.unittitle: Artists and other celebrities; prints, photographs, and artifacts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographic images including cabinet cards, cartes de visite, 8x10s, 5x7s as well as a selection of etchings, engravings and lithographs. The cabinet cards include actors, actresses, opera singers and musicians signed and unsigned ranging primarily from 1880-1910. The cabinet cards include over 800 different actors, actresses and other entertainment personalities such as Maude Adams, Elizabeth Clark, Pauline Hall, Julia Marlowe, Edwin Booth, Benoit-Constant Coquelin, and Richard Mansfield. Musical performers from the late 19th century are also included such as Jesse Bartlett-Davies, Agnes Huntington, Adelina Patti and Cyril Tyler. There are a substantial amount of mid twentieth-century celebrity 8x10s including a large number of operatic personalities. There also includes a number of oversized opera posters and large card sized images, many of them signed. The etchings and prints are primarily from the 1800's. They include images of famous actors and performers in their specialty roles such as Charlotte Cushman, E.L. Davenport, Edwin Booth et al., mostly taken from older collector series books. The cartes de visite are mostly unorganized and include theatrical, musical and cultural personalities from the mid to late nineteenth century. Some artifacts are included as well, a one-of-a kind Jenny Lind empire clock given to P.T. Barnum, two small busts of Enrico Caruso, and some unidentified costume items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by material type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files include correspondences, photographs, clippings and two unidentified daguerreotypes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various correspondences between Henry Porter and Anne Seymour, and others regarding May Davenport Seymour and the Davenport family known in theatre and film including Fanny Davenport and Edgar L. Davenport.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondences between Henry Porter and Mt. Auburn Cemetary regarding the upkeep of her grave. Also includes clippings and a stereoscopic of her home. See also box 110.

did.unittitle: Letters by and about Margarete Arndt-Ober and care packaeges

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondences between Henry Porter and Margarete Arndt-Ober regarding care packages he was sending to her in Germany after the war. Includes receipts of packages and clippings of her career.

did.unittitle: Photos and letters of Olga Sapio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mostly photographs of Sapio as a child, growing up with her family. Also includes programs of her performances, clippings, some negatives and letters concerning her returning to the concert stage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two unidentified daguerreotypes, one of an elderly woman, one of a man with a child each in a leather frame. One unidentified tintype of a young girl.

did.unittitle: RCA Victor clippings, photos and letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings on the company, a photograph of the house where the first gram-o-phone was developed and a correspondence between Henry Porter and RCA regarding the changing of the RCA symbol.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings and photographs of many of his roles. Also includes commemorative stamps and a letter signed by Caruso. See also box 110.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings and photographs of many of her roles, some signed. Includes some letters to Porter regarding sending help to Margarete Arndt-Ober and includes copies of Farrar's birth and death certificates. See also box 110.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed program of Luella Melius and a program from the Boston Theatre's production of The Trail of the Lonesome Pine. Also includes two illuminated prayers previously framed by Porter.

did.unittitle: Herbert I. Jackson photos, clippings and letter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs and programs from productions he worked on. Also includes a letter from Jackson's daughter regarding his effects to be made available since his death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Frame is 17" x 20", photo is 9 1/2" x 11 1/2." It is possible that this picture belongs to the Arthur W. Row papers, although we were unable to confirm this.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black lace fan given to Alice Nielsen by Leonora Duse in 1902 at Naples, Italy. It was used by Alice Neilsen when she sang the role of Violetta in "Traviata" after three weeks coaching by Duse. Cabinet card of Eleonora Duse also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three crowns, possibly used by Olive Fremstad (see MS 003/002-91:11). One with rhinestones, one with cameos and one of metallic vines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unspecified items including two Wedgewood plates with the profile of JFK and Winston Churchill, a blue teacup and saucer with an opera(?) figure on it, a figurine with pigs and a grammophone, a silver goblet (probably used as a prop) and a plastic framed picture of Adelina Patti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes original programs and ticket stubs from the concerts, stereoscopes and cartes de visite of the Coliseum, a broadside from a concert by Camilla Urso (1863), and a cabinet card of Ebew Jordan. Also clippings of 20th C. commentary about the event.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes original and facsimiled letters by and between OF and Maynard Manning (an avid Fremstad collector), Mary Watkins Cushing (Fremstad's secretary and biographer) and Henry Porter. The series also includes an original working manuscript and galley copy of The Rainbow Bridge, Cushing's book on Fremstad. There are also numerous photographic images of her famous roles including Salome and original photographs of her family, her home in Maine and her wedding. There are photographs of Maynard's collection of her costumes and a magnetic album of photos and clippings which has not been broken up. There is also a monogrammed handkerchief belonging to Fremstad and a number of crowns which could possibly have belonged to her.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by material type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains 78 RPM recordings. Includes some notes from the album covers and an original leaflet from the Scarlatti album. Includes Madrigals and other selected works by Monteverdi on the HMV label, Fourteen Sonatas for Harpsichord by Scarlatti on the Columbia label and the Dumbarton Oaks Concerto on the Keynote label and Symphonie de Psaumes on the Columbia label both by Stravinsky.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by composer.

did.unittitle: Political, military, and judicial figures; photographs, prints, and clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains mostly photographs and prints of political, military, and judicial figures plus a few clippings. Most images are duplicates, in albums, autographed, and many recent ones are dedicated to Porter. We have not determined which portraits or signatures are originals; dates of creation are unclear. Of note are signatures of all American presidents from George Washington to Ronald Reagan as well as John Hancock, Robert Kennedy, and Earl Warren. See also series one for portraits of political figures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by political, military/political, and judicial figures.
